intro: Carpodetus serratus, commonly known as the serrated evergreen holly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant has small, leathery leaves with serrated edges, and its flowers are typically clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forest understories, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
